intro: Critoniopsis pendula, commonly known as the hanging bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its pendulous, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are ovate and covered in a fine, velvety texture. The flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, range in color from white to pale blue.
